text.0: sensory ganglionopathy is characterized by sensory loss without weakness. A common pathophysiological mechanism is autoimmunity. This review focuses on acquired sensory ganglionopathies, most commonly seen in patients with an autoimmune disease or a paraneoplastic disorder.
text.1: Amid ongoing efforts to reduce the risk of #COVID19 infection in correctional facilities, researchers are considering whether incarcerated people should be included in efficacy trials of vaccine candidates after there is some evidence that such vaccines are safe.
text.2: The efficacy of tocilizumab was tested in an RCT involving patients with #COVID19 who had fever, pulmonary infiltrates, or a need for supplemental oxygen. The treatment had no significant effect on disease progression, independence from supplemental oxygen, or death.
text.3: Perspective: When All You Have Is Quality of Life
text.4: The CDC made a strong recommendation that passengers on public transportation — and transportation workers — wear face masks to help prevent #SARSCoV2 transmission.
text.5: The NEJM Clinical Cases Resource Center aggregates educational content and interactive cases to help medical professionals advance their clinical diagnostic and therapeutic skills, and to provide engaging resources for teaching, continuous learning, and professional development.

text.7: Perspective: Health Policy in a Biden Administration
